caption: This is one of the places that make Paris what it is. Strolling along the Seine, you'll certainly meet the bouquinistes stands. Whether you want to buy a book or not, youshould stop and browse what they offer. Rive Droite or Rive Gauche, visiting Paris without stopping would be missing what is an inseparable part of the charm of Paris.

Always a pleasure to talk with the booquinistes de quai St-Michel et quai du Pont Neuf, you can find old book or ask for specific subject , books. Magazines , journals , pins , posters and postcards.   Both walks are nice one near Samaritaine and one near Notre-Dame

If this was March 2019 I would have given this four stars. A lot of kitsch, but I found an interesting thing or two. I returned to Paris in September 2021 and this is what I find. All the time. Not sure if they're operating on regular basis but like everything in France I'm sure they're regulated and if so they should be opened at set hours. No longer worth your time since these people don't seem to be interested in making money.
Most of the bookstalls weren't open when we went, and the once that were open only had books in French (which is perfectly understandable). The had some really lovely posters and paintings, though.
I bought some books for my sister back home. The man who helped me was just absolutely lovely. You have to at least take a look if you pass by!
Simply a real Parisian experience. Lovely and most of them are authentic.
so beautiful, great for posters
I often go there to look for grafic novel. Always smiling
Love Love Love all the little book vendors on the Seine!
Very serious and reliable, Mr. Ichard bought many books from me and took care of finding a resource that could take what did not suit him. It was a real relief.

Almost all the book sellers are super nice and smiling! Always a pleasure to wander around and make great finds. It‚Äôs really charming and a great way to buy and bring back souvenirs from Paris that are a little different :)

What's good about second-hand booksellers is finding books that you can't find anywhere else, and they're very kind, and it's one of the well-known images of the capital, even as I walk along the quays. always look to see if there is a book that interests me and I find one from time to time, that's why we have to encourage them on the internet

We met Mr. Henri following a specific request. He was able to find us the rare gem and the price was all in all very reasonable. This was not the first time we had used his services. We will come back. Thank you Mr. Henri, don‚Äôt change anything!

Listed as a world heritage site. . Here the spirit of the lights accompanies you along the quay... Books, magazines, comics, records, gadgets, etchings, etc. Lots of things in a minimum of space... Nothing is more pleasant than discovering a book from your childhood, the front page of a magazine by a late star, finding the book you are looking for. ... Give yourself some time and enjoy Paris Plage to read or reread your find.
Excellent box: one of the best on the docks! A very good choice in literature and fine arts. And reasonable prices. It's always a pleasure to find old books on the quays!
I am divided. It's really typical of the banks of the Seine in Paris and we find some gems. On the other hand, many remain closed and the cabins are in such a state of disrepair.  It's a shame
There you go, we're going to move the second-hand booksellers who have been there for a long time, for the Olympics, what a shame!  It is a Paris institution.
The offer is very commercial, not many rare books but I like it all the same!!!
Dirty and ugly boxes offer books that can be found elsewhere, spoiling one of the most beautiful views of Paris, too bad.
There are all kinds of interesting books
Excellent booksellers...with rich boxes full of treasures for all lovers of good literature...the best on the Right Bank on this subject..
Very nice typical Parisian place. To come and see, lots of choices of books and postcards
Obligatory stop at the second-hand booksellers, a tradition, a most pleasant exchange and great finds in perspective.
Always a pleasure to wander around the second-hand bookstores to find a souvenir of Paris without breaking the bank!
Charming and unique, you must visit to have a real experience in Paris
Large selection, price allowing many people to satisfy their desire to read
Second-hand bookstore, posters, photos, interesting
username: Rafael GARCIA DE LA MATA ESCUDERO
